test_scenarios.scenario_name: Test empty state when no templates exist

steps.expected: An appropriate empty state message should be displayed
steps.actual: Initial page load shows error message. However, when clicking 'Add Template' button, an appropriate message is displayed: 'You must save an existing page as a template prior to create a new template.'

issues: Initial page load shows misleading error instead of clean empty state, but Add Template button correctly shows guidance message

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Attempt to create template for testing

steps.action: Navigate to Pages panel and select Home page
steps.expected: Home page selected and Save Page Template option visible
steps.actual: Successfully navigated to Pages and selected Home page

steps.action: Click Save Page Template > Evoq Page Template
steps.actual: Form appeared with Template Name and Description fields

steps.action: Enter template name 'Test Home Template' and click Save
steps.actual: Save failed with HTTP 400 Bad Request error

issues: Template creation API returns HTTP 400 Bad Request error preventing new template creation

observations: The Templates module has significant backend API issues preventing normal functionality
GetPageTemplates API consistently returns HTTP 500 Internal Server Error
Template creation API returns HTTP 400 Bad Request error
The error message 'There was an error retrieving your content. Please check your internet connection' is misleading - it's actually a server-side error
Code review shows the feature implementation (HTML, JS, C# controller) appears correct, suggesting the issue may be in the data layer or configuration
The 'Add Template' button correctly shows guidance text when no templates exist, indicating partial functionality
The UI components (search box, Add Template button, panel layout) render correctly - only the data loading fails
